reasoning: Triple vessel disease refers to significant stenosis in all three major coronary arteries, representing advanced coronary atherosclerosis. Estimated incidence ~45 per 100k based on prevalence in coronary angiography studies showing TVD in 15-25% of angiography patients combined with overall CAD incidence estimates. Confidence limited due to heterogeneous definitions and registry-based data rather than population epidemiology.
source: Clinical coronary angiography registries; CASS (Coronary Artery Surgery Study) and similar catheterization databases
